items.title: NASA, SpaceX Launch US-European Satellite to Monitor Earth’s Oceans - NASA
items.content_text: The Sentinel-6B satellite lifted off aboard a SpaceX Falcon 9 rocket from Launch Complex 4 East at Vandenberg Space Force Base in central California at 9:21

items.title: NASA Sets Launch Coverage for International Ocean Tracking Mission - NASA
items.content_text: NASA will provide live coverage of prelaunch and launch activities for Sentinel-6B, an international mission delivering critical sea level and ocean data to

items.title: 2025 News Releases - NASA
items.content_text: Sign up to receive NASA news releases and other information.

items.title: Monday’s Research Studies Ways to Protect Eyes and Lungs in Space - NASA
items.content_text: Expedition 73 kicked off the week exploring how to prevent space-caused vision problems and what happens to the respiratory system in microgravity. The International Space Station residents also worked on combustion research and Earth observation gear, organized food and cargo inventory, and serviced life support systems.

items.title: Week Wraps on Station With Cardiac Research, Stem Cells, and Eye Checks - NASA
items.content_text: Cardiac research, stem cell observations, and eye checks to ensure astronaut health wrapped up the week for the Expedition 73 crew aboard the International Space Station. The orbital residents also continued working on spacesuits and unpacked a pair of resupply ships rounding out their work week.

items.title: NASA, SpaceX Launch US-European Satellite to Monitor Earth’s Oceans
items.content_text: Sentinel-6B will extend a decades-long legacy of global sea level measurements that help forecast weather, protect coastal communities, and more.

items.title: NASA, European Partners Set to Launch Sentinel-6B Earth Satellite
items.content_text: Set to track sea levels across more than 90% of Earth’s ocean, the mission must first get into orbit. Here’s what to expect.

items.title: 6 Things to Know From NASA About New US, European Sea Satellite
items.content_text: Data from Sentinel-6B will continue a decades-long record of sea surface height, helping to improve coastal planning, protect critical infrastructure, and advance weather forecasts.

items.title: NASA Sets Launch Coverage for International Ocean Tracking Mission
items.content_text: The agency is preparing to launch Sentinel-6B, an international satellite that will measure sea surface height for 90% of the planet’s ocean.

items.title: JPL Workforce Update
items.content_text: A message from JPL Director Dave Gallagher

items.title: NASA-ISRO Satellite Sends First Radar Images of Earth’s Surface
items.content_text: Preliminary images from the most powerful Earth radar satellite ever launched offer a tantalizing glimpse of the science the mission will be able to deliver.

items.title: NASA’s Webb Explores Largest Star-Forming Cloud in Milky Way
items.content_text: Webb’s MIRI, managed by NASA’s Jet Propulsion Laboratory through launch, helped reveal the star-studded Sagittarius B2 molecular cloud in unprecedented detail.

items.title: NASA’s Deep Space Communications Demo Exceeds Project Expectations
items.content_text: The project has exceeded all of its technical goals after two years, setting up the foundations of high-speed communications for NASA’s future human missions to Mars.

items.title: NASA-ISRO Satellite Lifts Off to Track Earth’s Changing Surfaces
items.content_text: The first-of-its kind satellite will provide actionable information in a range of areas, including disaster response, infrastructure monitoring, and agricultural management.

items.title: October 2025 Company Update
items.content_text: As Terran R development continues to advance, we’re excited to share updates from October across design, build, test, and launch. items.title: September 2025 Company Update
items.content_text: The Terran R program continues to build momentum, and September delivered meaningful progress across design, manufacturing, testing, and launch. items.title: August 2025 Company Update
items.content_text: Throughout August, the Terran R program continued to make measurable progress toward first launch, delivering on critical program milestones.
